00009 #import "ASIInputStream.h"
00010 #import "ASIHTTPRequest.h"
00011 
00012 // Used to ensure only one request can read data at once
00013 static NSLock *readLock = nil;
00014 
00015 @implementation ASIInputStream
00016 
00017 + (void)initialize
00018 {
00019         if (self == [ASIInputStream class]) {
00020                 readLock = [[NSLock alloc] init];
00021         }
00022 }
00023 
00024 + (id)inputStreamWithFileAtPath:(NSString *)path
00025 {
00026         ASIInputStream *stream = [[[self alloc] init] autorelease];
00027         [stream setStream:[NSInputStream inputStreamWithFileAtPath:path]];
00028         return stream;
00029 }
00030 
00031 + (id)inputStreamWithData:(NSData *)data
00032 {
00033         ASIInputStream *stream = [[[self alloc] init] autorelease];
00034         [stream setStream:[NSInputStream inputStreamWithData:data]];
00035         return stream;
00036 }
00037 
00038 - (void)dealloc
00039 {
00040         [stream release];
00041         [super dealloc];
00042 }
00043 
00044 
00045 // Ok, so this works, but I don't really understand why.
00046 // Ideally, we'd just return the stream's hasBytesAvailable, but CFNetwork seems to want to monopolise our run loop until (presumably) its buffer is full, which will cause timeouts if we're throttling the bandwidth
00047 // We return NO when we shouldn't be uploading any more data because our bandwidth limit has run out (for now)
00048 // The call to maxUploadReadLength will recognise that we've run out of our allotted bandwidth limit, and sleep this thread for the rest of the measurement period
00049 // This method will be called again, but we'll almost certainly return YES the next time around, because we'll have more limit to use up
00050 // The NO returns seem to snap CFNetwork out of its reverie, and return control to the main loop in loadRequest, so that we can manage timeouts and progress delegate updates
00051 - (BOOL)hasBytesAvailable
00052 {
00053         
00054         if ([ASIHTTPRequest isBandwidthThrottled]) {
00055                 [readLock lock];
00056                 if ([ASIHTTPRequest maxUploadReadLength] == 0) {
00057                         [readLock unlock];
00058                         return NO;
00059                 }
00060                 [readLock unlock];
00061         }
00062         return [[self stream] hasBytesAvailable];
00063         
00064 }
00065 
00066 // Called when CFNetwork wants to read more of our request body
00067 // When throttling is on, we ask ASIHTTPRequest for the maximum amount of data we can read
00068 - (NSInteger)read:(uint8_t *)buffer maxLength:(NSUInteger)len
00069 {
00070         [readLock lock];
00071         unsigned long toRead = len;
00072         if ([ASIHTTPRequest isBandwidthThrottled]) {
00073                 toRead = [ASIHTTPRequest maxUploadReadLength];
00074                 if (toRead > len) {
00075                         toRead = len;
00076                 
00077                 // Hopefully this won't happen because hasBytesAvailable will have returned NO, but just in case - we need to read at least 1 byte, or bad things might happen
00078                 } else if (toRead == 0) {
00079                         toRead = 1;
00080                 }
00081                 //NSLog(@"Throttled read %u",toRead);
00082         } else {
00083                 //NSLog(@"Unthrottled read %u",toRead);
00084         }
00085         [ASIHTTPRequest incrementBandwidthUsedInLastSecond:toRead];
00086         [readLock unlock];
00087         return [[self stream] read:buffer maxLength:toRead];
00088 }
00089 
00090 // If we get asked to perform a method we don't have (which is almost all of them), we'll just forward the message to our stream
00091 
00092 - (NSMethodSignature *)methodSignatureForSelector:(SEL)aSelector
00093 {
00094         return [[self stream] methodSignatureForSelector:aSelector];
00095 }
00096          
00097 - (void)forwardInvocation:(NSInvocation *)anInvocation
00098 {
00099         [anInvocation invokeWithTarget:[self stream]];
00100 }
00101 
00102 @synthesize stream;
00103 @end
